title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 03 October 2014 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:24 <vmassol> has quit  
06:01 <Denis> has quit  
06:02 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:46 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:06 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
07:07 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:15 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
07:22 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
07:48 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:05 <drbignik> has joined #xwiki  
08:13 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <DarkKnightCZ> can i somehow create page in subwiki using XWikiXmlRpcClient?  
08:41 <vmassol> Hi DarkKnightCZ, it should probably work I'd sy  
08:41 <vmassol> \*say  
08:41 <vmassol> you just execute the call using the subwiki's URL  
08:41 <vmassol> doesn't it work?  
08:42 <vmassol> note that xmlrpc is kind of old and deprecated, been replaced by our REST API  
08:43 <DarkKnightCZ> nice, missed that, thanks  
08:43 <vmassol> "So anybody that wants to use a version of this application using the new non-dual-licensed version of the library would actually have to come to the XWiki Iași office and shake hands with Marius. Or keep using the older version." ;)  
08:43 <vmassol> I wonder how many people will do this....  
08:46 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:50 <DarkKnightCZ1> has joined #xwiki  
08:50 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
08:52 <DarkKnightCZ2> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
08:53 <DarkKnightCZ2> is now known as <DarkKnightCZ>  
08:54 <DarkKnightCZ1> has quit  
09:19 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
09:38 <DarkKnightCZ> is there a way, how to force restful api to use custom authentication mechanism? (possibly the one that normal xwiki uses)  
09:39 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: hmm I don't know but probably not  
09:41 <DarkKnightCZ> hehe, that's not too good :) i use sso authenticator which effectively breaks the rest authentication :) (you can't have multiple authentication headers and there is no cookie)  
09:45 <vmassol> one more thing to improve :)  
09:45 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, but there is XWikiUser xwikiUser = xwiki.getAuthService().checkAuth(xwikiContext); in rest server internals  
09:56 <tmortagne> pretty sure REST service is reusing configured authenticator but maybe there is some issues on the REST related specifics  
10:05 <DarkKnightCZ> yup, it looks like it's working (apparently tomcat filters work differently for local addresses)  
10:07 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
10:08 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <mflorea> vmassol, tmortagne: check my last mail on devs when you have some time, thanks :)  
10:50 <tmortagne> mflorea: yep currently reading it  
10:50 <vmassol> will do  
10:54 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: is that ok? ^  
11:29 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:40 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: yes thanks  
11:41 <DarkKnightCZ> you're welcome  
11:41 <drbignik> has quit  
11:54 <kanedafromparis> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <vmassol> mflorea: replying now  
12:25 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:47 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:09 <AFKGeek> has quit  
13:23 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
13:24 <Enygma`> question about contrib: Once a user gets a repository and gets commit rights, does he get rights only on that repository, or does he get rights on all the repos under the xwiki-contrib organization?  
13:24 <Enygma`> from what I can see it`s the latter and, IMO, that`s kind of broken.  
13:25 <Enygma`> vmassol: ?  
13:26 <cjd> yes, the latter  
13:26 <Enygma`> well that`s broken  
13:27 <evalica> it's broken from a quality point of view  
13:27 <Enygma`> a newbee user just requested a repo on contrib and he was granted access to \*all\* repos  
13:27 <cjd> it's the svn model, anyone can jump in on any project, otherwise you'd keep the project in your personal repo  
13:27 <Enygma`> then, the next thing he did was to approve a pull request on some other repository where he magically got access  
13:27 <Enygma`> no, that`s broken  
13:28 <Enygma`> this makes pull requests = 0  
13:28 <Enygma`> if anyone can circumvent it  
13:28 <Enygma`> you escaladare rights by asking for a bogus project  
13:28 <Enygma`> and then you start directly committing on the project you are really interested in  
13:28 <Enygma`> we need to fix this  
13:29 <cjd> if you feel that the svn model is broken or not fit for xwiki contributions, I agree, but not because I think people are evil and will slip sneeky code into other projects  
13:29 <evalica> actually I don't like the realtime-wysiwyg … I think I should remove some pages :)  
13:30 <cjd> git remote set-url origin [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection):cjdeisle/... :)  
13:30 <cjd> git push  
13:30 <Enygma`> I was talking about the whole logic behind pull requests  
13:30 <cjd> I need a command line script for making new repos on github, I can do everything else from the comfy shell  
13:30 <Enygma`> this setup we have completely defeats its purpose  
13:30 <evalica> it's nice to have this kind of rights when everybody is trust worthy .. but on contrib we create repos without any questions...  
13:32 <cjd> I think from a risk PoV it's no problem because there just isn't anything worth enough to attack  
13:32 <Enygma`> how about quality?  
13:32 <cjd> but once a person transfers their project over to a forge, they nolonger own it and so it gets abandoned  
13:33 <cjd> everything in my personal repo is (should be) maintained or die(s)  
13:33 <evalica> all the high quality applicaitons on e.x.o are on contrib  
13:33 <cjd> aka is maintained or deleted  
13:33 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <Enygma`> cjd, not worth attacking? There are apps that get on e.x.o and then into enterprises' wikis. Might want to rethink that statement.  
13:33 <cjd> mhm, they're all developed by XWiki SAS which has a company policy to use that repo  
13:34 <evalica> contrib is not for XWiki SAS (there are others too that have access there)  
13:37 <cjd> mm I was just about to say "bring it up on the list" but actually \*that\* is a broken system so good luck getting consensus on anything there :)  
13:37 <acotiuga> has quit  
13:38 <ppantiru> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <Enygma`> thinking more about it, I kind of understand the reasons why it's like that. The xwiki-contrib org is more of a free-for-all area, as opposed to the xwiki org (where only approved committers do stuff).  
13:48 <Enygma`> basically if any problematic user on contrib stands out, he can easily get his rights revoked or only restricted to his project  
13:49 <Enygma`> the best practice is to use pull requests is it's not your project and you are a newbee  
13:49 <Enygma`> or if you just need validation for your change  
13:49 <Enygma`> if you`re 100% sure about it, go ahead and push, even in other repos  
13:53 <tmortagne> Enygma`: I don't think the current xwiki-contrib model is broken, sure people can do crap but on active project other people will revert  
13:53 <tmortagne> it's pretty much like saying that wiki model is broken  
13:55 <Enygma`> tmortagne: the whole spark was the pull request mechanism, for which you don`t have an analogy with the wiki model  
13:56 <Enygma`> though, as mentioned, pull requests on contrib have more of a consultative nature when compared to pull requests on xwiki  
13:58 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
13:59 <tmortagne> sure it's a feature wikis (at least XWiki) don't have that's all, but it's still the same thing, what is important is that in the end the bad things are reverted (and the bad citizen get fired if needed)  
13:59 <msmeria> has quit  
14:00 <Enygma`> yes, I guess  
14:00 <tmortagne> note that right from the pull request UI you have a revert button  
14:01 <tmortagne> not sure if it reopen the pull request but at least it revert the changes  
14:02 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:02 <cjd> part of the cleverness of the wiki model is to give more power but with the ability to revert, that way people get things done instead of endlessly scheduling meetings to get someone with the right security clearence  
14:02 <vmassol> Enygma`: I also disagree with you  
14:02 <vmassol> it's not broken and it was done like this voluntarily  
14:02 <vmassol> it's very good that someone was able to accept a PR on another project  
14:03 <vmassol> now if the PR wasn't good we just need to tell that to whoever accepted it and dsicuss with him/her  
14:03 <vmassol> what we wanted is to encourage cross-project contributions  
14:04 <vmassol> we're not a lot already and putting barriers would just be plain stupid  
14:04 <cjd> how many were there?  
14:04 <vmassol> of what?  
14:04 <cjd> cross-project contributions  
14:04 <vmassol> don't know, hundreds  
14:04 <tmortagne> hard to know since we don't really know who is from which project  
14:04 <cjd> [citation needed]  
14:04 <cjd> ;)  
14:04 <Slashman> has quit  
14:04 <vmassol> how many problemes were there?  
14:05 <vmassol> how long did it take you to handle credentials?  
14:05 <cjd> oh 0 security problems, I never suggested there was a security issue :)  
14:05 <vmassol> how many lists do we have?  
14:05 <cjd> talk to Enygma` about that  
14:05 <vmassol> etc  
14:05 <vmassol> seen our current # of issues we got and the size of our community  
14:05 <vmassol> which is about 1-3 persons per contrib project  
14:06 <vmassol> it would be bad to create silos  
14:06 <cjd> mmm businesses don't like code ownership because they like to imagine all employees as replacable fireable assets  
14:06 <cjd> I think  
14:07 <cjd> but code ownership is popular in github  
14:07 <vmassol> "[citation needed]": you could do some stats on how many people contributed to more than 1 project  
14:07 <vmassol> cjd: if you want code ownership  
14:07 <vmassol> don't give your repo to the xwiki-contrib org!!!  
14:07 <vmassol> that's exactly the opposite  
14:07 <vmassol> the goal is to not have ownership  
14:07 <cjd> /nod  
14:08 <tmortagne> we don't provide git hosting, github do it already, the point of contrib is to put the project in a community were more people that know about XWiki have the right to participate to the project  
14:14 <Enygma`> Indeed, I did clarify this above. Thanks and sorry for the noise.  
14:18 <vmassol> no it's interesting to discuss and that we garee :)  
14:19 <vmassol> \*agree  
14:19 <vmassol> s/no/np  
14:19 <tmortagne> probably mean it's not clear enough on http://contrib.xwiki.org  
14:20 <tmortagne> (even if it does seems to be explained)  
14:22 <Enygma`> I still don`t think the whole "donation of code" thing is explained well enough on the contrib.xwiki.org  
14:22 <Enygma`> it is implied though...  
14:23 <Enygma`> but as Vincent mentioned, we did not really hear that many complaints  
14:26 <tmortagne> the first sentence which is "The XWiki Contrib Project provides hosting for projects related to XWiki." is probably a bit misleading (yes most people only read that :))  
14:35 <tmortagne> Enygma`: WDYT of "XWiki Contrib is a community dedicated to collaborative development of XWiki related projects and extensions in the spirit of wiki communities." to replace the first sentence ?  
14:38 <Enygma`> tmortagne: sounds good to me, at least we remove the "hoting" part  
14:39 <tmortagne> and I find it a bit more sexy that a simple hosting :)  
14:39 <Enygma`> should we or should we not drop the word "forge" in there?  
14:41 <tmortagne> Enygma`: don't know, the definition of a forge to me is not much more that "a bunch of projects"
